item.title: SQL Joins: The Ultimate Guide to Not Breaking Your Database
item.description: Hey there, SQL enthusiast! Ever felt the thrill of joining two tables and getting exactly the data you wanted? Or the panic when your query runs for hours and your database starts smoking?

item.title: Higher-Order Thinking: How Scala's Functional Abstractions Simplify Complex Logic
item.description: I remember staring at a Python script at 2 AM, tracing through nested loops and conditional logic that processed user analytics data.

item.title: Scala Options: Stop Fearing Null, Start Loving Safety
item.description: If you’re coming from Python, you’re probably used to this pattern: user = get_user(user_id) if user is not None: process_user(user) else: print("User not found") And you’re probably also used to this happening in production:

item.title: Building My First Data Pipeline
item.description: Just deployed my first end-to-end pipeline using Airflow, S3, and Redshift. Here’s what I learned about idempotency and backfilling…
Currently Reading Fooled by Randomness, by Nassim Nicholas Taleb After reading Antifragile, I fell in love with Nassim’s wit and insights into randomness and uncertainty.

item.title: Books & Papers
item.description: No book yet Right now I’m working on papers that actually mean something. Curious what’s been feeding my brain? Check out my readings →

item.title: Contact
item.description: Feel free to get in touch about anything you see here. Email: zeid@obtbe.com Telegram: @obtbe I maintain a mailing list where I announce new data and programming-focused articles and resources.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Personal and open-source projects in data engineering, tooling, and automation. If you have questions or comments about any of these projects, please feel free to get in touch.

item.title: Mastering SQL Subqueries: Your Secret Weapon for Smarter Queries
item.description: SQL queries can feel like magic when you need exactly the right answer from your data. And subqueries? They’re the quiet superpower behind some of the cleanest, most powerful SQL you’ll ever write.

item.title: Linear Regression vs Logistic Regression - Understanding the Differences
item.description: Data analysis often uses two tools: linear regression and logistic regression. They sound alike, but they answer different questions. This article breaks down their differences with clear examples and the math behind them, so you can choose the right one for your data.

item.title: Scala for Angry Beginners: From Frustration to Functional
item.description: Let me guess: you’re a perfectly competent Python developer who’s been told you need to learn Scala. Maybe it’s for a new job, maybe it’s for that Spark project, or maybe you just heard it pays well.

item.title: What Running a Coding Boot Camp Taught Me About Programming
item.description: I’ve always loved coding. As a data nerd, I spend my days tinkering with Python scripts and digging into datasets. So when I got the chance to run a six-week coding boot camp for beginners in early 2022, I was thrilled.

item.title: About
item.description: Ever since I was a kid, I’ve been fascinated by two things: numbers and nature. My grandad, who spent most of his life around horses, had a big hand in that.
